column4: new GRUB seems to send signal to the numlock key to turn it on at boot
so it's hard to enter a password
on a laptop keybpard
because most keys get locked
also sometimes it turns on mute and I have to shutdown and turnon
turn on*
also yesterday at boot Unity disappeared and I got the non-unity 10.10 interface
why is natty so buggy?
because it was just released
:P
if you want stable your best bet is 10.04.02
10.04 is stable. 11.04 is not devel.
long story short I don't care if you like 10.04 or not. You asked for stable
and if you like the dev version then expect it to be unstable
Guest29994; lol
11.04 is a final release / not a dev version but it's also very new. It has passed beta and all the RC but I bet in the next 18 months of it's life it will receive thousands of patches
I think so too
so now you know why it's not "stable"
ya
we'll probably have 11.10 before 11.04 is really stable
anyway I don't mind it has nice interface

I run 10.04 on all of the servers I manage, on my home desktop and on my laptop and am running, as of 20 minutes ago 11.04 on my office workstation. 10.04 is pretty damned good IMHO and only a idiot would run 10.10, 11.04 or 11.10 on a server
10.04 is LTS or long term support release which comes out every two years and is designed to be stable from the ground up. The downside is it doesn't always have the latest software
